intro: Diodia radicans, commonly known as groundcherry or false sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into round, orange fruits resembling cherry tomatoes. Diodia radicans is a perennial herb that spreads via rhizomes, forming dense mats in its native habitat. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
